myfiles.index:
Welcome to My Files Version 4.0

This Help Document will provide some helpful details on operating My Files interface
If you have used the old version of My Files, please click here to find out what's different
Home Access Plus+'s My Files allows you to transfer documents to and from your Educational Establishment by just using a web browser.

Interface Basics

The My Files interface contains 3 distinct areas:

  1. Toolbar
    Shows up when you move past the drive selection page, allows you to Create a New Folder, Upload a file from your local machine, filter the current view for something, or change the View Style
    For more information on the Toolbar click here
  2. Drive Tree
    Allows you to quickly navigate to a folder in a tree layout, simular to Window Explorer's Tree. You can drag files/folders from the list to the tree to move them (holding CTRL will copy them instead), or by Dragging a file from Windows Explorer, Upload a file to that specific Folder.
    For more information on the Tree click here
  3. Item List
    The list (tiled/iconed/detailed) displays a list of drives/files/folders in a Windows Explorer styled interface. You can drag files/folders around to move them (holding CTRL will copy them), right click to rename, delete, and more. The List also allows you to drag files from Windows Explorer to Upload them.
    For more information on the list click here

 

To get started, close this Help Box, and give it a try. Once you have chosen a drive (single click), opening a file/folder in the List is done by double clicking on them. Single Clicking on them Selects them to allow for multiple deleting. SHIFT and CTRL replicate standard Windows Explorer Actions
 


For a full list of My Files Help Sections, click here
myfiles.whats-new:
What's New to My Files in Version 4.0?

  • Completely Rewritten Interface
  • Works by just using HTML and Javascript, no more silverlight
  • Drag and Dropping files/folders around the interace**, like the old Extended Edition
  • Drag and Dropping of files from Windows Explorer to upload**
  • Ability to Select Muliple Files to Upload when you click the Upload Button*
  • Improved Preview Mode
  • Folder/File Properties, displaying File/Folder Size, Creation Date & Time, and More
  • Improved Speed compared to both previous versions
  • Improved Searching/Filtering of the main list compared to both previous versions
  • Consumes less bandwidth (for those with limited data caps)
  • Ability to Copy as well as Move Files
  • Ability to Open a ZIP file as if it were a folder, without having to download it
  • Use of HTML5 and CSS3 Technologies to improve your experience
* - Except Internet Explorer 7 and below ** - Except Internet Explorer 7 and Mobile Browsers


For a full list of My Files Help Sections, click here
myfiles.toolbar:
The Toolbar

The toolbar appears when you move past the Drive Selection interface, and allows access to some key features, including:

  • Going Back
  • Creating a New Folder
  • Uploading a Document to the Current Folder via a Select Box
  • Searching/Filtering the current view for a specific item
  • Changing the current View mode to view the items in a different order
When the View Mode is Changed to Details, another part of the toolbar is made visible, the coloumn headers.
 

When you scroll down the page, the toolbar sticks to the top of the page so you can always get at the toolbar without having to scroll back to the top.
Note: The toolbar is not sticky on Mobile devices
 


For a full list of My Files Help Sections, click here
myfiles.tree:
The Tree

The tree allows you to quickly delve into a any folder you have access to, and then quickly navigate to it.
 

It works in the same way as the Tree you have in Windows Explorer to navigate through various folders on your PC
 

It also supports Drag and Drop interfaces allowing you to copy/move/upload files/folders directly to that folder without leaving the current location
 

Note: Please see Drag and Drop for Supported Browsers
 


For a full list of My Files Help Sections, click here
myfiles.draganddrop:
Drag and Drop

My Files supports Dragging and Dropping Files and Folders around the interface, even from outside the browser to upload files**
 

Dragging and Dropping Items to Copy/Move them

To Move, or Copy a File or Folder, simply drag that file(s)/folder(s) (can move more than 1) to the folder you want to move/copy that item into.
 

If you want to Copy a File instead of Moving it, hold down the CTRL key on your keyboard to switch the mode to Copy instead of Move
 

If a file already exists in that folder, you will be asked if you want to overwrite it
 

Dragging and Dropping Files to Upload Them

To upload a file into a folder, simply drag it from your explorer window onto the folder you want. Keep an eye next to the Upload button to give you an indication of where it will be uploaded to.
Once you are happy, just let go and the upload will be started.
 

If a file already exists in that folder, you will be asked if you want to overwrite it
 

A progress indicator will become visible down the bottom of the page
 

Drag and Drop Uploading is supported in:

  • Internet Explorer 10+
  • Firefox 3.6+
  • Chrome 6+
  • Opera 11.1+
  • Opera Mobile 11.1+
  • Android Browser 3+

 


For a full list of My Files Help Sections, click here
myfiles.newfolder:
Creating a New Folder

To create a New Folder in the current folder, simpily click the New Folder button, a text box will appear for you to type your new folder name into
 

Once you are happy with the name, either hit enter on your keyboard or click Create
 

The current view will refresh once the folder has been created
 


For a full list of My Files Help Sections, click here
myfiles.delete:
Deleting Items

To delete items, select the items, right click on them to get the right click context menu up, then click on Delete
 


For a full list of My Files Help Sections, click here
myfiles.contextmenu:
The Right Click Context Menu

This menu allows you to conduct selected actions on the currently selected items
 

It is found by Right Clicking on any item, or in mobile browsers, hold down on an item until the in-browser menu is displayed, cancel the in browser menu and the right click context menu will be visible
 


For a full list of My Files Help Sections, click here
myfiles.search:
Searching/Filtering the Current Folder

You can Search/Filter the current Folder to find a specific item, this is done in realtime as you type into the Search Box
 


For a full list of My Files Help Sections, click here
myfiles.renaming:
Renaming

You can rename an item by choosing Rename from the right click context menu
 

All you need to do is change the the text in the textbox that is shown on the current item. This only works on 1 item at a time
 


For a full list of My Files Help Sections, click here
myfiles.properties:
Properties

You can get additional information on items by choosing Properties from the right click context menu
 


For a full list of My Files Help Sections, click here
myfiles.preview:
File Preview

You can get a Preview of Selected Files by choosing Preview from the right click context menu
 

Note: A preview is a "best possible" quick view of the chosen document. It will not always look identical to the actual document
 

Supported Files are:

  • Open XML Office Word Documents - .docx
  • Excel Worksheets - .xls, .xlsx
  • Plain Text Documents - .txt
  • Images - .bmp, .png, .jpg, .gif

 


For a full list of My Files Help Sections, click here
myfiles.googledocs:
Google Docs

New in My Files is the Option to Send specific files to Google's Documents Storage System so you can edit them
 

You can Send a Specific file to Google Docs by choosing Send to Google Docs from the right click context menu
 

You will be asked for your Google Username and Password so the file can be uploaded
 

Once the document has been uploaded a new window will open directing you to your Google Docs Storage
 

Supported Files are:

  • Word Documents - .doc, .docx
  • Excel Worksheets - .xls, .xlsx
  • Power Point Files - .ppt, .pptx, .pps, .ppsx
  • Text Documents - .rtf, .txt
  • Adobe Portable Document Formatted Files - .pdf

 


For a full list of My Files Help Sections, click here
myfiles.upload:
Uploading Files

If your browser supports it, you can Drag and Drop files from outside of the Browser to Upload them, see Drag and Drop for more information
 

The other way of Uploading Files is via the Upload button on the Toolbar
 

When you click on the Upload button a dialog will be shown asking you to select a file (or on supported browsers you can select multiple files, see Drag and Drop for a list of supported browsers)
Once you have chosen your files click Upload to Start the Upload Process.
 

If you have a supported browser Home Access Plus+ will check to see if the file already exists and prompt you to overwrite it if it does

A progress indicator will then appear at the bottom of the page

 

Once the file has been uploaded the page will reload to show the file
 


For a full list of My Files Help Sections, click here
myfiles.views:
Views

My Files has the ability, much like your Folder Explorer (Windows Explorer, Safari Spotlight) to change the current view to get more/less information
 

My Files does this via the View button on the Toolbar, clicking on this will show a list of possible views you can choose from
 

Selecting one will change the view
 


For a full list of My Files Help Sections, click here
myfiles.list:
The Main List

The Main List displays the list of files/folders in your currently selected file

Once you have opened a Drive (i.e. not at the drive selection level), selecting an item is done via Single Clicking, and navigating to that folder is done via Double Clicking it

Welcome to the Booking System

This Help Document will provide some helpful details on operating the Booking System interface
Home Access Plus+'s Booking System allows you to book IT resources in your Educational Establishment by just using a web browser.

Interface Basics

The Booking System interface contains 3 distinct areas:

  1. The Calendar - This is a calendar which is shown when you clock on the Date in the top left of the Booking Grid. It allows you to change the date that is shown in The Bookings Grid. It is limited to what the administrator has decided is the most advanced date you can book (usually 2 weeks from the beginning of the week).
  2. The Bookings Grid - This is a grid containing all of your Establishment's Resources which you can book. You can also remove your booking from this interface if you have made a mistake.
  3. The Booking Form - This form allows you to book a resource for a specific time and date

 


For a full list of My Files Help Sections, click here
